title: 105_hr3300
content: The "Small Business Pension Start-Up Credit Act of 1998" allows small employers to receive a credit for pension plan start-up costs under section 45D of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Small Business Pension Start-Up Credit Act of 1998 provides eligible employers with a credit equal to 50% of qualified start-up costs for establishing a pension plan, with a maximum credit of $1,000 for the first year and $500 for the second and third years. Eligibility is based on the definition of an eligible employer in section 408(p)(2)(C)(i). The term "eligible employer" excludes employers who maintained a qualified plan in 1997 with contributions or benefits for service that year. If only certain individuals can participate in the plan, the exclusion applies regardless of other qualified plans. Qualified start-up costs are defined for the purposes of the Small Business Pension Start-Up Credit Act of 1998. The term 'qualified start-up costs' refers to necessary expenses incurred in establishing a qualified employer plan before January 1, 2001, with at least 2 eligible participants. Expenses for plans established after December 31, 2000, are not included. Section 4972(d) outlines special rules for aggregation of persons treated as a single employer. It disallows deductions for qualified start-up costs if a credit is determined under subsection (a). Taxpayers can elect not to claim the credit for a taxable year. The credit is allowed as part of the general business credit under Section 38(b) of the Code. In Section 4972(d), special rules for aggregation of persons as a single employer are outlined. It disallows deductions for start-up costs if a credit is determined under subsection (a). Taxpayers can choose not to claim the credit for a taxable year. The credit is part of the general business credit under Section 38(b) of the Code. Additionally, there are conforming amendments related to the small employer pension plan start-up cost credit. The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Code is amended by adding a new item at the end. Sec. 45D. Small employer pension plan start-up costs. The amendments apply to costs in taxable years after the enactment of this Act.
